series_description: This series documents any records created to evaluate or inspect cooks, food preparation, food quality or food service.
disposition: year after evaluation, then destroy.

series_description: This series documents any records created to control the meal preparation process, including, but not limited to assignments, recipes to be used, start times, cooking times, and supplies or foodstuffs to be used.
disposition: month after meal date, then destroy.

series_description: This series documents the receipt of and compliance with special diet requirements for selected individuals, generally based on special medical or religious needs. Employee Health Certificate This series documents the receipt of medical clearance for employees to work in food service operations. Fiscal Accounting Records This series includes any records created to account for, monitor or control funds spent or collected by the food service activity.
retention_statement: Retain 1 certification compliance Refer to Refer to Schedule guidelines.
disposition: year or until completion of any required audit, whichever is greater; then destroy in with No. 8 on schedule cover page. records series 012261, “Health Certificates”. General Records Retention and Disposition No. GS-102, Fiscal Records for retention

series_description: This series documents the request, issue and control of bulk foods received by the facility from any source, including USDA, vendors and agency warehouses.
disposition: years or until completion of any required audit, whichever is greater; then destroy.

series_description: This series documents the control of food costs, including but not limited to: average meal costs, recipe costs and special dietary costs.
disposition: years or until completion of any required audit, whichever is greater; then destroy.

series_description: This series documents the internal control of foodstuffs and condiments, includes issues to cooks and other kitchen workers, and disposal of spoiled items.
disposition: years or until completion of any required audit, whichever is greater; then destroy.

series_description: This series documents the receipt of medical clearance for employees, volunteers, students, patients or inmates to work in food service operations.
retention_statement: Retain 2 or completion whichever 8 on schedule
disposition: years after departure/reassignment of individual of any required certification audit, is greater; then destroy in compliance with No. cover page.

series_title: Hi/Low Sheets This series includes records of meals prepared versus meals actually served and any other record kept to assist in predicting future number of meals to be served.
disposition: year or until completion of any required audit, whichever is greater; then destroy.

series_title: Housekeeping/Cleanup Records This series includes any record used to assign housekeeping or cleanup responsibilities, document completion of assignments or evaluate performance of assignments.
disposition: month, then destroy.

series_description: This series documents any required daily control or inventory of knives and other utensils or equipment for security purposes.
disposition: year or until completion of any required audit, whichever is greater; then destroy.

series_description: This series documents other inventories not listed on this schedule or other schedules.
disposition: long as administratively necessary, then

series_title: Inventory Records Perpetual Inventories of Stocks
series_description: This series documents the routine control of foodstuffs, condiments and other consumable supplies.
disposition: months after stocks reduced to zero balance, transferred to a new record or in accordance policy, whichever is greater; then destroy.

series_title: Logs, Checklists or Control Records This series includes any food service log, checklist or control record not otherwise listed on this schedule.
disposition: year, then destroy.

series_description: This series documents the completion of daily counts, registers or sign-in sheets the track the number or names of diners at each meal.
disposition: month, then destroy.

series_title: Menus and Standardized Recipes This series includes all required or standardized menus that are used by kitchen personnel.
disposition: superseded, obsolete or rescinded, then

series_title: Modified Diet Census This series includes any records used to collectively plan the preparation of special diet requirements over time, including menu planning and special orders.
disposition: months, then destroy in compliance with No. 8 cover page.

series_description: This series documents the routine inspection of sanitary conditions in food preparation, storage or serving areas.
disposition: years after inspection or until completion of any certification audit, whichever is greater; then

series_description: This series documents certification that an individual has passed a course on sanitary/safe handling of food, utensils, cooking equipment and serving lines.
disposition: year after end of food service duty/employment certification, then destroy.

series_description: This series documents requests to the US Department of Agriculture (USDA) for refund of expenditures in support of USDA sponsored programs.
disposition: years after request or until audited, whichever is then destroy (7CFR250.16).

series_description: This series documents the preparation and submission of reports required by the US Department of Agriculture (USDA) to control USDA provided foodstuffs, condiments or funds.
disposition: years after report submission or until audited, is greater; then destroy (7CFR250.16).
